page.title: 06Fields & Tracks - Paignton
page.content: There used to be sheep in this field because you can see wool on the barbed wire. It is full of buttercups and daisies. There is a horse in the field and a buzzard flies overhead. Following a gravel track, the banks on either side are made from mud, with dried grass, ferns, pink flowers, stinging nettles and blackberry plants.There are red campions, bluebells, dandelions, dog rose and honeysuckle underneath the powerlines that sag wearily from pylon to pylon. Now there are oak trees on the banks of the lane also one big beech tree. At the foot of the beech tree there is a fox hole. There is corn in one field, whilst in the next, the grass has been cut for silage.
